greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=127 instead of a(1)=2.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..47
mathematica: a[1]=127; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a, 10]
program: first(m)={my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=127; for(i=2, m, v[i]=spf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v;} /* _Anders Hellström_, Aug 18 2015 */
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
